item.question: You started an application (`myapp`) in the foreground. How do you push this running application into the background without restarting the application?
item.choice: It is not possible without restarting the application.

item.question: Which of the following syslog-priorities represents the highest level of importance?
Which RPM command displays all files belonging to package `foo`?
Which of the following statements about "symbolic links" is true?
item.choice: A symbolic link can be recognized by filetype "l" as being the most-left character in the output of `ls -l`.
It is not possible to point a symbolic link to a directory in another filesystem.
The filesize of a symbolic link is always less than 256 bytes.
The command `find / -type s` only displays symbolic links.
A symbolic link does not have its own inode-number.
item.correct_answer: It is not possible to point a symbolic link to a directory in another filesystem.

item.question: Which of the following commands will do the same as `kill -s INT 3022`. Select all that apply.
Which of the following will copy the text-file `file1` to `file2`? Choose all correct answers.
On a Debian system which runlevels represent multi-user? Select all that apply?
You want to know the previous runlevel your system was running. Which command can be used to find the previous runlevel?

You started the program `rups` in the background and you notice it consumes a lot of resources. Which of the following commands can you use to make the command you just started use less CPU resources?
Which command will set the the default permissions for your files to `rw-r-----`, regardless of the current setting?

You plugged in a USB DVDROM drive. The `dmesg` command told you it was detected as device `/dev/sdc`. There is no fstab-entry for this device in `/etc/fstab`. Which of the following commands can you use to mount the media in that drive to the (existing) directory `/mnt/dvdrom`?

You need to install linux on a laptop with a 1.66 GHz processor, 2 GB of RAM and a 160 GB harddisk. The user made clear he wants support for suspend and hibernation. How much space on the disk would you allocate to be used as swap?
You issue the following command with root-privileges. What will happen to your system?
item.choice: Your system will make eating sounds (yum, yum)
Your debian system will be upgraded to the new stable version
Your redhat system will be upgraded to the new release version
Packages already installed will be updated if a new version is available
item.correct_answer: Packages already installed will be updated if a new version is available

item.question: You downloaded a nice piece of software in RPM format. You are running Debian Linux. Which of the following would help you to install it on your system?
Which Linux command is used to repair corrupted filesystems?

You are working on a Debian system and you made a mess of the "samba" configuration file. Unfortunately you forgot to create a backup of the configuration file. Which of the following would allow you to make a fresh start with the initial "samba" configuration from the debian samba package?
item.choice: It is not possible without reinstalling samba.

item.question: What command will send the `HUP`-signal to the webserver-process httpd` (process id 2384) causing it to re-read its configuration?
Which condition(s) must be true if two directories require each their own quota for filesystem usage?
item.choice: They must exist on Ext3 partitions
The directories must have the setgid permission set.
They must be on different partitions
They must be mounted by the root user
item.correct_answer: They must be on different partitions

item.question: How would you set the sticky bit on a directory?
Which file is the main configuration file for the init process?
What is the meaning of setting the sticky bit permission on a file?
item.choice: nothing, sticky bit has only meaning when set on a directory
the file will be persistent in memory
the file can only be deleted by the owner or a user with root-privileges.
the file can never be deleted by a regular user
item.correct_answer: nothing, sticky bit has only meaning when set on a directory

item.question: Which of the following commands will create an ext3 filesystem on device `/dev/hdb3`? Select TWO answers.
You are a regular user (not `root`) and want to examine the PCI bus configuration. What command can you use?
item.choice: None of the above, it is only possible with `root`-privileges.

item.question: Consider the following script: You set a variable's value with the command "export MYVAR=hello" and then after executing the script, you type the command "echo $MYVAR". What would be the output of the command?
You changed the file `/etc/inittab`. What would be your next action to make the change effective?
item.choice: Use the command `kill` to send the `HUP` signal
item.correct_answer: Use the command `kill` to send the `HUP` signal

item.question: Which of the following device names point to "logical" partitions?
Which command is used to change the owner of a particular file?
Which command will display a list with all installed RPMs?
You want to set a 20 second delay before your system boots to the default operating system. Which of the following command lines would do this?
What command will show the first 10 lines of a file by default?
Which filesystems are mounted using `/etc/fstab` when you issue the command `mount -a`?
item.choice: All filesystems except those on removable media.
None, you forgot to specify a device-file and mount location.
All filesystems except those that have `noauto` specified as mount-option.
item.correct_answer: All filesystems except those that have `noauto` specified as mount-option.

item.question: You enter a command (`mycmd`) in `bash` and want to redirect both standard output and standard error output to one file (`mylog`). Select all correct answers.
A job is running in the foreground. Pressing [Ctrl]+[KEY] pauses this job and gives you control of the terminal. What is [KEY]?
Which of the following would uninstall lilo?

You are editing the file `foo` with `vi`. You want to save the changes with '[ESC]`:w`', but `vi` complains you do no have sufficient rights. Therefore, you want to check the permissions on that file. How do you manage this without leaving `vi`?
The ________ directory is world writable. Therefore it should be on a separate partition (filesystem) to prevent users from filling up the root-filesystem.

item.exhibit: boot=/dev/sda map=/boot/map install=/boot/boot.b vga=791 default=debian keytable=/boot/nl.klt lba32 prompt timeout=100 message=/boot/message menu-scheme=wb:bw:wb:bw image=/boot/vmlinuz label=failsafe root=/dev/sda10 initrd=/boot/initrd.img append=" ro failsafe" read-only image=/boot/vmlinuz-2.6.32-21-generic label=debian alias=debian-2.6.32-21-generic root=/dev/sda9 read-only image=/boot/vmlinuz-2.4.8-26mdk label=redhat root=/dev/sda10 initrd=/boot/initrd.img append=" ro" read-only other=/dev/fd0 label=floppy unsafe
item.question: Consider the following "/etc/lilo.conf" file: Assume that the `lilo` command has been executed using the above configuration. How long will the system wait before starting the default OS and which OS will be booted after the timeout exceeded?
item.choice: The system boots after a 10 second delay, and will boot from `/dev/sda10`.
The system boots after a 10 second delay, and will boot from `/dev/sda9`.
The system boots after a 1 second delay, and will boot from `/dev/sda9`.
The system boots after a 100 second delay, and will boot the image labeled as `debian`.
item.correct_answer: The system boots after a 10 second delay, and will boot from `/dev/sda9`.

item.question: What is the result of the following command?
item.choice: You will get the shell secondary prompt
The text "echo ATcomputing" will be printed

item.question: How can you disable only the group quota in `/extra`?
Which option can be used with the shutdown command to `fsck` on the next reboot?
With the command __________ you can display a file in octal format. Provide only the name of the command.
You have setup quota-support for the home-directories. Which command allows the sysadmin to set quota's for a specific user?
Which command will show you a list of your previously executed commands?
Which command would you use to display how many inodes are available on the `/home` filesystem?
On an ext3 partition, what portion of the datablocks on the filesystem is reserved for the root user by default?

You created a new filesystem on the first harddisk (`sda`) third partition which you will mount on `/extra`. You now want to enable the quota system for users on this new filesystem. Which of the following uommands would you use to enable the quota-system and make it effective for users? Choose all that apply.
item.choice: add the mount option `usrquota` to the `/etc/fstab` options column for
add the filesystem with mountpoint `/extra` to `/etc/fstab
item.correct_answer: add the mount option `usrquota` to the `/etc/fstab` options column for
add the filesystem with mountpoint `/extra` to `/etc/fstab

item.question: Which of the following commands can be used to examine kernel bootup messages after boot time?
You execute the following command: What will be the result?
item.choice: Only filenames in the user's homedir will be listed in the file `list.txt
All directorynames will be listed in the file `list.txt
All filenames in the user's homedir and any errors reported by `find` will be listed in the file `list.txt
All filenames in the user's homedir will be printed in the terminal and any errors will be written to `list.txt
item.correct_answer: All filenames in the user's homedir and any errors reported by `find` will be listed in the file `list.txt

item.question: What command can be used to make init reload its configuration file?
What will be the result of the command `cd ~guru0`?
item.choice: Changes directory to the user guru0's home directory
Changes to directory named `guru0` in the current directory
item.correct_answer: Changes directory to the user guru0's home directory

item.question: Which runlevels shouldn't you select as default runlevel in `/etc/inittab`? Select all answers that apply.

item.exhibit: $ touch nicefile $ ls -l nicefile -rw-r--r-- 1 guru0 cursus 0 Sep 28 13:57 nicefile
item.question: Consider the following exhibit: What is the most probable value of the umask set for user `guru0`?
Which command line can be used to restart a running Linux system immediately?
You are editing a file in vi and are currently in command-modus. Which of the following vi-commands will move the cursor 5 lines down and 2 characters to the right?
You are using disk quota on your system. With the command ___________ (full path name) you can see disk quota details.
Consider the following piece of code that uses tabs to indent lines: What command will easily convert the tabs to 8 spaces?
Which of the following commands makes `/tmp/myfile` readable by everyone but readable/executable only by its owner?
Which of the following entries from a file `/etc/fstab` are correct? Choose all answers that are correct.
What command can you use to create a link (`newdir`) to an existing directory (`existingdir`) in the same filesystem?

You want to run a command that uses the variable `CONFFILE` to locate the file it should use for configuration. Which of the following commandlines can you use in a BASH shell to make sure the command uses the configuration-file "top.conf". Select two.
